data.title: Connecting Green Hydrogen Europe 2025
data.meta_description: Explore our impressive lineup of sponsors at Connecting Green Hydrogen Europe Conference & Exhibition. Discover the industry leaders, innovators, and supporters who are driving the development of green hydrogen in Europe. Our sponsor list showcases the diverse range of companies and organizations committed to shaping a sustainable energy future. Join us in recognizing and appreciating their invaluable contributions to the advancement of green hydrogen technology.
data.text:
About Carburos Metálicos

Carburos Metálicos is a leading company in the industrial and medical gases sector that produces, distributes and sells gases for multiple sectors: metallurgy, glass, water, food, medical, energy, petrochemicals, laboratories, freezing, refrigeration, oenology, leisure and beverages. The company provides a wide range of products, solutions and services to its customers, as well as materials and equipment for gas applications.

Founded in 1897, Carburos Metálicos has been at the service of Spanish industry for 125 years and has always maintained a strong link with society.

Carburos Metálicos has a team of more than 700 professionals in Spain, a daily production capacity of more than 1,200 tonnes of liquefied gas (mtpd), 12 production plants, 14 packaging plants, 2 high purity gas laboratories and an R&D centre located in Bellaterra (Barcelona) that provide service to more than 100,000 customers. Since 1995, the company has belonged to the US group Air Products (NYSE:APD).

About Resato Hydrogen Technology

Resato Hydrogen Technology is a Dutch technology leader that supports the development of the hydrogen economy with their Hydrogen Refueling Stations. With more than 30 years of experience in high-pressure technology, Resato has the expertise to bring hydrogen under the correct pressure even under extreme conditions. Resato has both deployed privately owned stations and public stations throughout Europe.

It is our mission to meet and exceed the expectations of our customers and end-users. We want to provide the best business tool for hydrogen refueling station owners, provide their users with a flawless refueling experience and be a top-notch sustainable company.

We are on our way for a greener future with a focus on sustainability, safety and efficiency.

Creating zero-emission mobility together.

About INOXCVA Europe BV

INOXCVA, a part of the US$ 3 billion capital INOX group of companies, is a globally acclaimed company offering comprehensive solutions in cryogenic storage, vaporization, and distribution engineering.

Based in Vadodara (Gujarat, India), INOXCVA has stamped its authority as a global market leader in the highly challenging field of vacuum insulated cryogenic equipment across the world, from India. Our forte being design, engineering, manufacture, supply & commissioning of turnkey packaged systems, INOXCVA is among the largest manufacturer of standard & engineered cryogenic equipment. These equipment are used for storage, distribution & transfer of Cryogens for entire Cryogenic Temperature range 2~200oKelvin (-271 to -73oC) for Helium, Hydrogen, Nitrogen, Oxygen, Argon, CO2, N2O, LNG & Ethylene. Cryogenic Bulk Storage and Transport Tanks, Large Engineered ASU Storage & Vaporization Package Systems.

Key word for survival is CLEAN ENERGY, thus humanity at all times, through generations, is in pursuit and continued quest for developing most economical sources of Green Energy. Having achieved Excellence in Design, Modelling, Analysis, Sourcing, Procurement and Manufacturing, INOXCVA is working continuously towards Clean Energy initiatives in LNG, Liquid Hydrogen & Fusion Energy.

Hydrom is the central and independent entity in charge of orchestrating the Oman’s interest in driving the national green hydrogen sector. The company was launched in 2022 following His Majesty Sultan Haitham bin Tariq Al Said's directive to structure and accelerate the development of the green hydrogen sector in Oman, and it is fully owned by Energy Development Oman (EDO) and regulated by the Ministry of Energy and Minerals (MEM).

Hydrom’s core mandate is to orchestrate the hydrogen sector development in Oman, master planning and delineating government owned land areas earmarked for large-scale clean hydrogen projects, structuring, and managing the process for lands allocation to developers, overseeing hydrogen projects execution as well as facilitating the development of hydrogen common infrastructure, connected ecosystem industries and hubs.

since inception, Hydrom has signed project development and sub-usufruct agreements for prestigious large-scale green hydrogen projects in Oman. These agreements along with others are expected to meet Oman’s committed hydrogen production target of 1 MTPA for 2030. These projects will require to deploy more than 12 GW of total installed renewable energy capacity in the respective land blocks in Al Wusta Governorate in proximity to the port of Duqm.

Axens group provides a complete range of solutions for the conversion of oil and biomass to cleaner fuels, the production and purification of major petrochemical intermediates, the chemical recycling of plastics, all natural gas treatment and conversion options along with water treatment and carbon capture.

The offer includes technologies, equipment, furnaces, modular units, catalysts, adsorbents and related services. Axens is ideally positioned to cover the entire value chain, from feasibility study to unit start-up and follow-up throughout the entire unit life cycle. This unique position ensures the highest level of performance with a reduced environmental footprint.

Axens global offer is based on highly trained human resources, modern production facilities and an extended global network for industrial, technical supports and commercial services. Axens is an IFP Group company.

About Chart Industries, Inc.

“Chart’s vision is to be the global leader in the design, engineering and manufacturing of cryogenic process technologies and equipment for the Nexus of Clean™; clean power, clean water, clean food and clean industrials, regardless of molecule.” Jill Evanko, CEO of Chart Industries. Our deep cryogenic expertise and proven track record makes Chart your ideal project partner to deliver hydrogen as a secure, clean, safe and affordable alternative to fossil fuels. With over 25 global locations we maintain accountability and transparency to all our team members, suppliers, customers and communities. We are committed to excellence in environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) issues both for our company as well as our customers.

About Wolftank Iberia

Brief summary of the company

Wolftank Group is a leading global technology partner for energy and environmental solutions. In the areas of energy mobility and logistics, the company supports customers in over 20 countries in implementing projects efficiently and in an environmentally friendly way. The Group develops and implements tomorrow’s technologies to decarbonise transport and build the infrastructure for zero-emission mobility – such as the turnkey supply of modular hydrogen and LNG refuelling stations. Its environmental solutions include environmental risk due diligence, customized soil and groundwater remediation services and recycling.

The company has been committed to decarbonisation since its founding. It has extensive expertise in hydrogen technology, with more than 20 years of experience in storage and refuelling solutions. The hydrogen portfolio includes multimodal H2 supply solutions for road, rail and marine transport as well as ready-to-use hydrogen refuelling solutions for buses or heavy-duty vehicles (350 bar) and passenger cars (700 bar). Find out more about the Group’s hydrogen technologies.

About Baringa

We set out to build the world’s most trusted consulting firm – creating lasting impact for clients and pioneering a positive, people-first way of working. We work with everyone from FTSE 100 names to bright new start-ups, in every sector.

We have hubs in Europe, the US, Asia and Australia, and we work all around the world. You’ll find us collaborating shoulder-to-shoulder with our clients, from the big picture right down to the detail: helping them define their strategy, deliver complex change, spot the right commercial opportunities, manage risk or bring their purpose and sustainability goals to life. Our clients love how we get to know what makes their organisations tick – slotting seamlessly into their teams and being proudly geeky about solving their challenges.

We have over 300 active clients in the energy sector and have worked with 70% of the largest infrastructure investors globally to advise on the allocation of over £150bn of capital into renewables. Our work in hydrogen spans global, system-led modelling and commercial analysis to project-level optimisation, due diligence and operational integration

As a Certified B Corporation®, we've proven that we've built social and environmental good into every bit of what we do.

About Calvera Hydrogen

Founded in Zaragoza in 1954, Calvera Hydrogen is the leading and pioneering firm in the European hydrogen industry. Calvera Hydrogen plays a key role in the energy transition and stands out for its positioning in the hydrogen industry value chain, as it is the only company in the world with a presence in all phases of the hydrogen logistics and distribution chain, from the moment the hydrogen molecule is generated until it is dispensed for final consumption. The company plays an important role in the manufacture of hydrogen infrastructure equipment for compressing, storing, transporting and dispensing hydrogen and other gases.

Backed by more than 40 years of experience in the design and manufacture of high-pressure hydrogen transport and storage equipment with the highest safety standards, it is currently the most important hydrogen refueling station manufacturer in southern Europe and the only one in Spain. The company has two production plants in Zaragoza and Épila and international presence throughout Europe and the US.

About efacec

Efacec purpose is designing a smarter future for a better life.

We do it by developing and delivering integrated solutions in the fields of energy, mobility, and environment, shaping the future of our cities, with digital connectivity always present.

With 100% Efacec technology, we offer a comprehensive and turnkey service, delivering custom-made solutions according to the specificities of each market.

Through transformers, switchgear, service, automation, energy, environment and industry, transportation and electric mobility we anticipate and shape the future.

We don’t know what the future will bring, but we know what we want to deliver before everyone else: innovative solutions to improve everyday life.

Because each one of us has a special and unique power to transform the world now, looking towards tomorrow.

About Vallourec

As a world leader in premium tubular solutions, present in over 20 countries, Vallourec provides its customers with global innovative solutions tailored to meet the energy challenges.

Building on more than 100 years of expertise in the Oil & Gas, Vallourec is preparing for the future by offering a complete portfolio of products & solutions meeting the challenges of the energy transition, especially for hydrogen, geothermal, and carbon capture utilization and storage markets. With Vallourec® New Energies, Vallourec accompanies customers in their energy transition activities by providing extensive expertise and robust products and solutions, but also by helping define new industry standards with the ambition to become an integral player of the low-carbon industries.

About Dover Fueling Solutions

Dover Fueling Solutions, part of Dover Corporation, comprised of the product brands Wayne Fueling Systems, OPW Fuel Management Systems, ClearView, Tokheim, ProGauge, Fairbanks, AvaLAN Networks and LIQAL, delivers advanced fuel dispensing equipment, electronic systems and payment, automatic tank gauging, and wetstock management solutions for petroleum and clean energy fuels to customers worldwide.

DFS are dedicated to offering cleaner and more environmentally friendly ways to

power vehicles. To help contribute to a greener planet, DFS have invested in a broad range of products and solutions that support a variety of clean fuels, including LNG, Hydrogen, LPG, CNG and electricity, alongside conventional fuel dispensers that have a lower impact on the environment.

Headquartered in Austin, TX, DFS has a significant manufacturing and technology development presence around the world, including facilities in Brazil, China, India, Italy, Poland, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom and the United States. For more information about DFS.

Bureau Veritas is a world leader in laboratory testing, inspection and certification services. Created in 1828, the Group has more than 82,000 employees located in nearly 1,600 offices and laboratories around the globe. Bureau Veritas helps its 400,000 clients improve their performance by offering services and innovative solutions in order to ensure that their assets, products, infrastructure and processes meet standards and regulations in terms of quality, health and safety, environmental protection and social responsibility.

Bureau Veritas is a key player in the energy industry, present at all stages of the renewable and alternative energy production chain. We provide services and solutions that accelerate the energy transition, and are dedicated to sustainability, notably in resources and production, bringing trust and transparency.

With our long-standing experience in energy industry, especially in risk & safety management and quality assurance, our overarching role is to bring trust to the hydrogen energy industry.

As an independent third party we can provide: certification of assets, certification of equipment, supply chain quality assurance, independent testing and measurement.

As a technical expertise provider, we can offer: owner’s engineer, technical advisory, permitting support, risk and safety management.

Gibson Dunn is a leading global law firm. Our lawyers have unrivalled experience advising clients on all aspects of the structuring, development and financing of some of the largest and most cutting edge low-carbon hydrogen (and ammonia) projects being developed globally.

As the energy transition gathers pace, there is much excitement around low-carbon hydrogen (and ammonia) from both within, and beyond, the energy sector. However, given the nascency of the low-carbon hydrogen sector, there are relatively few projects actually in development and even fewer sector professionals with real-life experience of developing these projects.

Our hydrogen specialists have developed market-leading expertise in the low-carbon hydrogen and ammonia space by working on actual projects (many of which from day 1), and engaging with real-world issues, meaning that we bring ‘live’ experience and the latest market knowledge to the matters that we advise on. The work our lawyers are doing in the sector is geographically spread, and we have acted for participants at different stages of the value chain, meaning that we have a unique overview of the market that we are able to leverage for the benefit of our clients.

In addition to active deal work, our lawyers are also thought leaders in the space and regularly speak at conferences and educational institutions, and publish articles in leading publications, on topics and issues relating to low-carbon hydrogen and the energy sector as a whole.

The Bosch Group is one of the leading global companies for technology and services and employs around 420,300 associates worldwide at more than 440 locations, subsidiaries, and regional companies in more than 60 countries. In 2022, the company was able to generate sales of 88.4 billion euros and EBIT from operations of approximately 3.7 billion euros. Bosch defines sustainability as securing the company’s long-term success while protecting the natural environment for future generations.

Hydrogen is a cornerstone of our strategy. In consequence we are bringing in our values and strengths along the entire value chain of a sustainable ecosystem. In doing so, we develop core products of electrolysis, stationary and mobile fuel cell applications. Utilizing our expertise of more than 100 years in industrialization and automation in combination with our digital service portfolio, we are convinced to drive the ramp-up of a green hydrogen ecosystem.
